translation1: "All Bosch electrical tools, pneumatic tools, and measuring instruments are carefully inspected, tested, and subject to strict quality controls by Bosch's quality assurance. Therefore, Bosch provides a warranty for Bosch electrical tools, pneumatic tools, and measuring instruments. This warranty does not limit the buyer's claims for defects under the purchase contract with the seller or any legal rights.We provide the following warranty for these tools according to the following conditions: We provide warranty in accordance with the following regulations (No. 2 - 7) by free repair of the tool defects that are proven to be due to a material or manufacturing defect within the warranty period. The warranty period is 24 months for commercial or professional use or equivalent use, and 12 months for non-commercial use.The warranty period begins with the purchase by the first end user. The date on the original purchase receipt is decisive. For all blue electrical tools and measuring instruments purchased on or after September 1, 2004, that are intended for commercial use (excluding high-frequency tools, industrial battery drills, and pneumatic tools), the warranty period is extended to 36 months if the buyer registers the tools within 4 weeks of the purchase date.Battery packs and chargers, as well as accessories included, are excluded from this extended warranty. Registration can only be completed online at [www.bosch-pt.com/warranty](http://www.bosch-pt.com/warranty). The registration confirmation is the registration receipt, which must be printed immediately, as well as the original purchase receipt from which the date of purchase is derived.Registration is only possible if the buyer agrees to the storage of the data to be entered there. Excluded from the warranty are: parts that are subject to wear and tear or other natural wear, as well as defects in the tool that are due to wear and tear or other natural use, anomalous environmental conditions, non-standard operating conditions, overloading, or lack of maintenance or care. Defects in the tool caused by the use of accessories, supplementary or replacement parts that are not original Bosch parts.Tools, on which changes or additions have been made. Minor deviations from the desired condition, which are insignificant for the value and usability of the tool. The rectification of the defect, which we recognize as warranty-bound, is carried out in such a way that we repair the defective tool free of charge or replace it with a flawless tool (if necessary also with a successor model).Replaced tools or parts become our property."
gpt_response: { "Fluency": { "Score": "5", "Explanation": "The text is highly fluent with correctly structured and natural English sentences. There are no errors in grammar, syntax or use of words. The sentences flow smoothly and are logically and clearly laid out. Each idea builds upon the one before it, providing for an intuitive comprehension of the content." } }

translation1: "Tire choice for racing bike - really that safe from punctures? This morning I woke up full of motivation to prepare for my bicycle tour next week by at least a little training. Well, I said and did it, and I rode my racing bike, which I bought yesterday on eBay.The first 40km were really beautiful - but then something happened that lurks in every city center (this time: Thank you, Krefeld!). Glass shards on the route. Zack, loud hissing and my rear tire refused to participate in the rest of the journey on any account.Since I couldn't get a replacement tire and tube on account of the day of the week, I had to turn around half-heartedly and take the first train back home. It wasn't technically that bad, maybe it's better if I practice the tire change again before the bike ride. But now I'm facing a question and I hope you can help me.Since I have a relatively long distance to cover over several days, I would really rather not have this problem more often. Now it wasn't too bad, since the old tires from the previous owner (a very nice old man who rode 120km on them until 2pm on the day I picked up the bike) were also suboptimal, as he had been riding on them for several years. But if I think about the fact that I have to change the tire after 80-90km of riding, I am really in a bad mood :DNow I have struck up a conversation with an older man at the platform, who asked me curiously why I didn't have the Marathon Plus tires; they are supposed to be indestructible. Of course, this all sounds very tempting now. But are they really unbreakable?I have little desire to spend 40€/tire now, only to be disappointed in the end. Furthermore, I am asking myself: I currently have on my racing bike, I believe, 25x622. This is also available (apparently?) in the Marathon Plus tires, but the majority is already wider.Is this a problem? Or would you generally recommend me to other tires for a racing bike? The Schwalbe side seems to be my absolute favorite! My layman's knowledge rather leans towards recommending the Durano DD.Thank you in advance for your help and best regards!"
gpt_response: { "Fluency": { "Score": "4", "Explanation": "The text is largely fluent, with minor awkward phrasings that don’t significantly impede comprehension, such as 'Well, I said and did it' which is a bit unclear as to the speaker's intent, 'Zack, loud hissing' where 'Zack' appears to be a term not usually used in English texts and 'refused to participate in the rest of the journey on any account'. The use of a semi-colon in the phrase 'I am really in a bad mood :D' may be viewed as inappropriate in formal writing but it is often used in internet writing to denote a pause longer than a comma but shorter than a period. These occasional awkward phrases and colloquialisms, however, do not significantly distort the message of the text or impede its readability." } }

translation1: "\"The party we wanted to throw\": Frankfurt celebrates after scoring-packed comeback against Leverkusen What a spectacular reaction from Eintracht Frankfurt. After 22 minutes, the Hessians, who had not won in their last two games, seemed to be on their way to another Bundesliga defeat.But then the SGE turned around, shook off the frustration of a mediocre start to the season within an hour, and won furiously with 5:2. \"It's crazy what the guys have done today,\" coach Oliver Glasner exclaimed on DAZN and gave a \"general praise\" to \"everyone who was involved.\" At first, it looked like another disappointment for the Frankfurt team, who are still behind their expectations in ninth place. Patrik Schick had put Leverkusen ahead 2:0.What then happened also impressed the SGE coach. \"How the players then came back and put on a fantastic performance,\" said Glasner further. I am incredibly happy with the performance we showed and of course also with the result.Even defender Christopher Lenz, who was able to play again for the first time since the fourth matchday and overcoming his muscle injury, emphasized the morale of his teammates. \"I believe our mentality is incredible,\" said the 27-year-old, looking forward to the result especially for the spectators. That was the party we wanted to throw today.For the upcoming tasks, Glasner will now keep the focus within himself, but he also feels well-prepared in terms of the personnel situation. It is extraordinary that we have all players fit in December, that all players are physically in top condition. It is top work in our medical department, but also the players are living highly professionally.Now, one wants to \"go step by step and remain humble\" and complete the tasks until the end of the year at this level. Next up, on Wednesday as part of the English week, there is an away game at Borussia Mönchengladbach (6:30 pm, Sky)."

translation1: "Since its introduction in 2001, the Valvetronix series from VOX has continuously evolved, including the combination of advanced modeling technology with the \"Valve Reactor\" circuit, which perfectly emulates the behavior of a tube amplifier. With the VT20X/VT40X/VT100X amps, we are presenting a brand-new modeling engine that is absolutely state-of-the-art in terms of sound. Thanks to the VET technology (Virtual Element Technology), which is based on the analysis of components and amp circuits, the VTX amplifiers deliver an authenticity that is absolutely impressive.Even these amps, of course, contain the multi-stage Valvetronix tube preamplifier. This is based in part on real analog circuits, because they simply do a better job of capturing the sound variations and nuances of a tube amplifier than any simulation. In addition to this sophisticated circuitry, the VTX amplifiers offer a closed housing and a bass reflex system from which the natural resonances simply burst forth.With the \"Tone Room\" software from VOX, you can even correct and distort historical facts on the virtual level until the amp and effects sound like you've always imagined. The perfect combination of tube sound with modeling technology is primarily due to the 2001 introduced VOX Valve Reactor technology. Of course, it has been refined several times since then to meet new sound requirements, which led to a performance boost for the VOX Valvetronix series in 2010 - with more dynamics and numerous and significantly improved amplifier models.From the compact VT20+ to the VT120+ with two speakers, the new VT+ Valvetronix series has been designed so that all guitarists seeking maximum sound diversity will find what they're looking for here. All guitarists dream of the warmth and dynamics of a tube amplifier: they expect a fat sound, nuanced reproduction of playing dynamics and string attack, and prompt response. During an in-depth analysis, VOX engineers discovered that the output stage determines the tube character of an amplifier and developed the VOX Valve Reactor technology based on this finding.The valve reactor circuit with a 12AX7 tube in every VT+ amplifier embodies the behavior, the subtle nuances, and the sound character of a tube amplifier perfectly."
gpt_response: { "Fluency": { "Score": "4", "Explanation": "The text is mostly fluent with minor errors but doesn't impede understanding. It would be better to say 'you can even customize and modify sound settings on the virtual level until the amp and effects sound like you've always imagined'. Overall, the text reads like a product description and does a good job in detailing the capabilities of the amplifier series." } }

translation1: "Federal Minister of Construction Klara Geywitz: Enteignment does not create new housing The new Federal Minister of Construction Klara Geywitz (SPD) has spoken out against the expropriation of large housing corporations, as has been demanded in a Berlin popular vote. \"With expropriation, not a single new housing unit is created, only the structure of ownership changes,\" Geywitz said in an interview with the \"Tagesspiegel\" (Sunday).My goal is to give tenants security that their rent will remain affordable in the next few years. By the way, a colorful mix of private landlords, cooperatives, or housing companies is the best protection against the formation of a monopoly. In Berlin, the coalition of SPD, Greens, and Left Party plans to establish an expert commission to decide how to proceed with the outcome of the referendum.But if the situation does not improve, Geywitz is not ruling out talks with the FDP in the traffic light coalition about further tightening of the rent law. The coalition agreement provides for a rent price brake until 2029, a limitation of rent increases in tense housing markets, and the expansion of the rent index. I will speak with the justice minister to implement this as quickly as possible.If the rental market doesn't loosen up anyway, \"we will talk to our coalition partners about further steps,\" emphasized the SPD politician."
gpt_response: { "Fluency": { "Score": "5", "Explanation": "The text is highly fluent with no grammatical errors, unnatural wording, or stiff syntax. The sentences are structured correctly and the ideas are linked seamlessly, making it easy to understand. The use of quotation marks for direct speech is also accurate." } }

translation1: "I am fed up with Sky Sport F1 Hello dear F1 fans, over the course of the season, the quality on German Sky has decreased more and more, so I want to vent a bit with this post. First of all, the transmission was interrupted mid-F2 race today to start the F1 pre-coverage on time.Although the delayed start and the accident at the beginning had put the schedule far behind schedule, it was still possible to show the last (planned) ten minutes and the championship decision (!). Apparently, however, this is not possible for legal reasons, so that everything else has to be restricted, which is why Sky DE probably had no choice. Nevertheless, it is stupid, especially since Sky UK was able to broadcast the end of the race.Nevertheless, a small praise: commentator Olivier Zwartjes did a good job of accompanying the difficult situation around the heavy accident. Then there was rule ignorance among the F1 commentators Sascha Roos and Ralf Schumacher, as both did not know that you can change tires under a red flag. Although there were similar situations in Imola, Baku, and Silverstone this year, both only came to the conclusion that Verstappen was allowed to change tires when there were corresponding radio messages about Hamilton.At Sky UK and RTL, both commentators knew immediately that this was possible for Verstappen. In my opinion, such basic rules should simply be known if you commentate on F1 at a pay-TV broadcaster. It is also not the first puzzle-guessing, as now according to the rules, both have simply constant uncertainties in the subject of rules.I do not generally like the artificial commentary style of Roos, but I acknowledge that it is a matter of taste. However, I seriously prefer Heiko Wasser from RTL. In addition, there are constant silliness that both simply appear unprofessional, such as ordering coffee from (equally clueless) reporter Peter Hardenacke or \"UuuuuHD\" from Ralf Schumacher.Just the latter brings a lot of turmoil into the commentary, as he apparently does not take it seriously. Not least, advertising simply takes over at Sky, where in the final round, Sky is the only channel that goes into advertising, as can be heard on F1TV, where only the German audio track without commentary is available directly after the race. Neither ServusTV nor ORF do this.Even these two broadcasters make less advertising during training than Sky, and they are free-to-air broadcasters. However, one must praise Glock and Baumgartner for their work, but that alone does not overcome the disadvantages. The rest of Sky Sport F1's program is also very meager and full of repeats.Overall, Sky is really the worst German-language broadcaster that covers the F1. Unironically, RTL does a better job with the four races they are still allowed to broadcast. Thus, the fantastic F1 season is much less enjoyable than it would be with a reasonable broadcaster.I would like to hear your opinion."
gpt_response: { "Fluency": { "Score": "4", "Explanation": "The text is mostly fluent, with some minor errors that do not impede understanding. There are a few instances of awkward phrasing and repetition, such as 'In addition, there are constant silliness that both simply appear unprofessional,' but these do not significantly hinder the reader's comprehension. The text flows well overall and the author's frustration with Sky Sport F1 is clear." } }

"Basketball Bundesliga: Derby disaster for MHP Giants Ludwigsburg against Merlins Crailsheim At least Johannes Patrick, the youngster, let them down. Again nothing: for the second time in less than three months, the giants lost in Crailsheim - and how!Before the game, Ludwigsburg's coach, John Patrick, had said with a look back on the cup defeat at the beginning of October against the Hakro Merlins Crailsheim: \"We still have some anger in our belly.\" But this didn't calm down after the game - on the contrary, it was further intensified in view of the 61:72 (28:38) defeat in the Basketball Bundesliga. Where more than the bare result, the manner of the appearance disappointed.A substitute statistic expresses the entire dilemma: The three-point shot percentage was a mere 13 percent, with 4 successful shots (all by young John Patrick) out of 31 attempts - any questions? John Patrick provided the answer: \"We were simply not focused enough after our win in Tenerife, and we didn't implement what we had trained for.\" Namely, moving the ball.His counterpart, Sebastian Gleim, reacted very differently: \"It's great to win the game for the second time against Ludwigsburg,\" said the happy coach. \"It felt like playing in front of 10,000 people.\" Although only 750 visitors were allowed on Saturday in the Hohenlohe Arena, they made the most of it.Not only because of BBL top scorer T.J. Shorts, who scored 22 points and led his team's game. \"The best playmaker I've ever trained,\" praised Gleim. While in Patrick's team, the key performers like Jordan Hulls (0 points) and Jonah Radebaugh (7) underperformed.Only in the last quarter (22:15) did the giants prevent a total disaster and came within eight points, after they had already trailed by 39:59. In addition to Johannes Patrick, Justin Simon also scored twelve points. Fortunately, there is not much time for complaining.Already on Wednesday (7 PM) the giants receive the Skyliners Frankfurt, then also in Ludwigsburg with a maximum of 750 spectators."

"I also think it's generally not appropriate to ask children to take on a parental role for their younger siblings. However, I do think it's good for older siblings to help out with their younger siblings to some extent. For example, looking briefly, helping briefly, bringing a bottle, etc.This way, they learn responsibility, help out in the family, and are involved. As long as they can still be children themselves, I don't see a problem with that. If your K1 is able to entertain themselves for a short period of time and it's okay for them, that's good.You can best judge for yourself whether this is suitable for your children. It's not as if he should be wrapped up in K2 and accompanied for hours while falling asleep. Legally, it is probably questionable.Perhaps this is also the statement of the psychologist. translation1: "Heavy \"Huidlerer\" question: Amberger knows the solution  What is a \"Huidlerer\"? This dialect word, sent in by an Amberger, has caused heated thinking in the BR television program \"Wir in Bayern\".But unlike on many previous days, the term remained unmentioned in the \"Host mi?\" series by the callers this time. No, it was not a \"person who is nervous\". And neither was it someone who \"has to go fast\".That, heard the people from the TV moderator, is completely wrong. Whereupon the man from Amberg provided the solution and thus probably also surprised many people from Upper Palatinate. \"The Huidlerer\", the viewers learned, \"is a rag with which someone wipes the oven.\"Dialect researcher Anthony Rowley, who has been consulted as an expert by Bavarian television for years, confirmed this. With the remark that this is a typically Upper Palatinate term, derived somehow from the more well-known dialect word \"Houdern\". Thus, a gap in education was closed - probably also for many who have lived in the Amberg area for a long time."
"But I have seen this with others. Is it then possible for you to send the lamp back? Because it is too low for over a dining table.I would also like to return them. Can you help me further?"

translation1: "Friedrich achieves 60th World Cup victory - Nolte wins in the two-man bob - Sport The brand of Norwegian biathlete Ole Einar Björndalen with 94 victories is the goal of the bobsleigh pilot. \"I've calculated it, I would have to win nine and a half races per season, then I could achieve it by Cortina 2026,\" said the double Olympic champion from BSC Oberbärenburg, who recorded two victories in two days at the races in Winterberg.First, he repelled Johannes Lochner's attack on Saturday by five hundredths of a second, moving from third to first place. Then he changed something in the material setup and on Sunday, he drove 0.30 seconds ahead with a larger lead. With his team Thorsten Margis (SV Halle), Candy Bauer (BSC Oberbärenburg) and Alexander Schüller (SV Halle), he beat the Briton Brad Hall.Third was the Austrian Benjamin Maier. \"We took a bigger risk today and were rewarded,\" said Friedrich, who also brought in his 22nd win in a row. Johannes Lochner, who drives for Stuttgart, moved up from second place to fifth place this time.Christoph Hafer from BC Bad Feilnbach finished eighth after placing fourth in the first race. \"If I knew what he was doing differently, I would do it too,\" said Lochner. Nolte with a home win - podium for Jamanka.At the women's event, Laura Nolte secured her third season win in the two-woman bob on her home track. After only managing fourth place in the monobob the day before, she stormed to victory in the German triple success with brakeman Deborah Levi in the two-woman bob race on Sunday. Two-woman bob Olympic champion Mariama Jamanka from BRC Thuringia finished second with Germany's fastest sprinter, Alexandra Burghardt from Burghausen.She recorded, in addition to her Olympic qualification, the first podium finish this winter. The woman from Wiesbaden, Kim Kalicki, finished third with Leonie Fiebig. For me, it was super cool to achieve my first podium finish in the World Cup. I am super happy that Mariama is accompanying me.I am super happy with the development. There is still a lot of potential at the start, but the start times today were okay,\" said Burghardt and emphasized: \"It's not just about pushing, there is also a lot to do around it.\" Jamanka was a little frustrated with the not entirely error-free rides, but said: \"It's going in the right direction.\""
